Text: Hey STFmaryville: What titles are you liking right now? You guys give us so many titles I can never decide what to read next. I saw you recommended Revival anything else your really liking?

Thanks for the ul.

Is it possible for you to ul GODLAND # 1-36?
Don't think anyone has done a complete run of that title.

Street_Disciple, thank you very much for asking me. I'm going to go crazy with this answer, so ... First and foremost, if you held a gun to my head and said "Name 3 comics that everyone should read right now!" then I might pick Captain America, Chew and Revival.

Yesterday I read the new Thor: God of Thunder series from Marvel NOW. It's very good.

At home, I am currently reading The Nearly Complete Essential Hembeck Archives Omnibus, and I'm willing to bet anyone $20 that they will not scan it.

The next title on my list is Morning Glories, followed by either Saga or Fables.

I have to read these, whenever they come out:

All New X-Men
Avengers
Captain America
Chew
Daredevil: End of Days (limited series)
G.I. Joe - A Real American Hero
Hawkeye
Injustice: Gods Among Us
Rachel Rising
Revival
Savage Dragon
The High Ways (limited series)
Transformers: Regeneration One
Ultimate Comics: Spider-Man
Walking Dead
X-Factor

Here are my favorite titles from the past:

Astro City
Bone (preferably the Scholastic color trades)
Damage Control (series of 3 limited series)
Miracleman
Nth Man: The Ultimate Ninja
Planetary
Preacher
Spider-Girl
Starman
Supreme (#41 and up)
The Authority (up until DC censored it)
Twisted Toyfare Theatre
Y: The Last Man

STFm: Sweet man thanks for the thoughts, I find I tend to read completed series the most as I am to impatient to read a series one month at time as they come out. I will definitely check some of these out thanks again dude. Not a big DC fan?

More of a Marvel fan, always have been. I think it's because when I was a kid, everything cool on TV was Marvel: Hulk re-runs, Spider-Man and His Amazing Friends, G.I. Joe and Transformers. So what happened? Marvel zombie.

I avoided listing pieces of an ongoing series like "Byrne's She-Hulk" or "Busiek and Perez on Avengers." But if I had, there would be more DC, like  "O'Neil and Aparo's Batman," "Sandman: Season of Mists," "Mark Waid on Flash," "Morrison and Porter's JLA." And for awhile there (circa 1991-1998) I'd buy Superman every month. And this is like digital gold to me: http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/8027882/

and binderguy1, i'm not ignoring you. i'm missing 2 of those 36 issues but am trying to d/l them.
really happy to see all your uploads. thanks again... also the upcoming 'pax americana' looks cool dont it!!  and that jupiters child thing, if its ever released.

wetbeak, yes i look forward to both of them, and it's like you said ... if they're ever released. frank quitely and john cassaday = i always calculate the odds of dying of natural causes before their next series comes out.  :-)

binderguy1, here ya go:
http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/8178891/
glad you asked about that series, as for some strange reason, i'd never heard of it. looks great!
Thanks for your downloads I look forward to comics from the Independants each week Do you have Bionic Man v,s Bionic Woman #2?
robotmaster, i looked for that earlier today and i know it was supposed to have been released but i'm not sure if it has been. i'll keep an eye out for it.
heh heh heh...  i am a very slow worker too... so what can ya do?   cross fingers... thank you for your kind response.
